column4: Most drivers are compiled as kernel modules and are therefore not actually loaded unless you actually have the hardware.
You should only need to compile the iwl4956 drivers as a module.  It should not require recompiling the kernel.
Bodsda: i know but when i try to modprobe the driver i get a error: not right symbols or something and someone told me i don't have the right libs or kernel
you will have to compile the module specifically for your kernel, but you shouldn't need to do more than that.
It sounds like you followed the correct steps (generically).  Have you installed the kernel headers.
yes and yes i read the README in the driver sorce
http://paste.ubuntu.com/26994/ is the readme
Thank you.  I'll take a look at it now.
any ideas ?
as long as you have the right headers, it should proceed normally.
yea i don't know what the problem is :(
it's really good to have you, and I'm sorry to say that compiling kernel modules is the one thing that hasn't improved.  ;)

we use ctrl+v to paste in windows ;)
it's not the same as selecting some text and the middle-clicking.  ;)

selecting and middle-clicking is a different clipboard than Ctrl-C/Ctrl-V (I use both back and forth).
try using ctrl-c and ctrl-v in terminal ;)
If try Ctrl-Shift-C and Ctrl-Shift-V if you want to copy and paste into GnomeTerminal.  ;)
but in fact, terminal is usually where I select/middle-click the most.
